org.lab99.mdt.view

Class Paper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.TextView
        • org.lab99.mdt.view.Paper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Button

    public class Paper
extends android.widget.TextView
    The Paper widget implement the basic idea of the Material Design.

    To implement the shadow and ripple effect of material design, a special wrapper Drawable, PaperDrawable is used as the view background. Any background set through the setBackground() or "android:background" will be set as inner background of the wrapper.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public static PaperDrawable apply(android.view.View view)
        Apply materials design on normal Android widget by wrapping the background with PaperDrawable.
        Parameters:
        view - the given normal android widget
        Returns:
        The created PaperDrawable wrapper background will be returned.

      • apply

        public static PaperDrawable apply(android.view.View touch_view,
                  android.view.View ripple_view)
        Apply materials design on normal Android widget by wrapping the background with PaperDrawable. This function is enable the separation of touch view and ripple effect display view, so, one can touch a widget, and the ripple is shown on the top larger transparent layer.
        Parameters:
        touch_view - touch view will trigger the state change event;
        ripple_view - the ripple view has to be able to receive 'onTouch' event
        Returns:
        The created PaperDrawable wrapper background will be returned.

      • setBackground

        public void setBackground(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable background)
        Set the inner background of the wrapper PaperDrawable, so the material design effect will not be affected if the background is changed by the user.
        Overrides:
        setBackground in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        background - The new drawable for the background.

      • getDepth

        public float getDepth()
        Get the shadow depth,
        Returns:

      • setDepth

        public void setDepth(float depth)
        Set the shadow depth. The depth is a relative depth to the view below, just the value for how the depth will be drawn. It's not the absolute z-depth. So, if the setDepth(1) on the below view, and setDepth(2) on the above view, the result shadow depth will still be 2, rather than 1.
        Parameters:
        depth - The depth value for the shadow.
